title.narrative: SSC maritime sector, Ghana - Phase II

description.narrative:
Strategic Sector Cooperation on Maritime Affairs Between Denmark and Ghana, Phase II
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on health is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Maritime Authority and the Ghanese Maritime Authority. The Strategic Sector Cooperation aims at improving the framework conditions for the maritime sector. The maritime sector is instrumental to support the transition from a developing economy into the group of (lower) middle income countries. About 90 per cent of Ghana’s growing international trade is by sea, and the coast provides the livelihood of an estimated more than 2 million people engaged in- or depending on fishery.
Building on Phase I the Danish Maritime Authority will continue and develop its collaboration with key public actors in order to contribute to improving the maritime framework conditions in Ghana. As a result, the international maritime playing field will be levelled to the benefit of Ghana and Denmark; the security of seafarers is improved and the livelihood of coastal communities is improved.
